description: From French tuméfier, from Latin tumefaciō, ultimately from tumeō, from Proto-Indo-European *tum-éh₁- (“to be swelling”), stative stem of *tum- (“to swell”).

verbs.description: tumefy (third-person singular simple present tumefies, present participle tumefying, simple past and past participle tumefied)

examples: to swell, tumefy, stiffen, not the diction only, but the tenor of the thought

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To swell; to rise into a tumour.
